etymology.description: 禾(禾) (hé, "grain") + 子(子) (zǐ, "child") = final part of harvest -> season
etymology.interpretation: The character 季(季) reflects the concept of harvesting, with 禾(禾) representing grain and 子(子) symbolizing the completion or offspring, conveying the idea of the end of a season when grains mature.

examples.chinese: 春季是万物复苏的时候(春季是萬物復蘇的時候)。
examples.pinyin: Chūnjì shì wànwù fùsū de shíhòu.
examples.english: Spring season is when all things begin to revive.

examples.chinese: 每个季都有独特的魅力(每個季都有獨特的魅力)。
examples.pinyin: Měi gè jì dōu yǒu dútè de mèilì.
examples.english: Every season has its unique charm.

examples.chinese: 夏季来了(夏季來了)，人们纷纷走出家门(人們紛紛走出家門)。
examples.pinyin: Xià jì lái le, rénmen fēnfēn zǒuchū jiāmén.
examples.english: Summer has arrived, and people are rushing out of their homes.
